There was a Vons was right around the corner so we were able to put juice and drinks in the fridge. The unit A/C blew right on one of the beds, but otherwise this basic hotel room was perfect for our needs. A place to sleep while we were being typical Hollywood and Los Angeles tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Catgirl10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for the price. The rooms were clean, good size, equipped well, friendly staff, free parking and nice swimming pool. Everything great only one thing happened was that we couldnt get into the hotel for 4 hours with our car as the police had closed the road in all directions as right outside the hotels drive the police had just shot down dead a guy who robbed a liquor store. A bit mental but they say tha doesnt happen very often. Other than that we felt really safe

Reviews.Title: “Great for the cost”
Reviews.Author: glyneth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 days when we arrived in LA. Good location next to the metro line, 3 stops to Hollywood Bvld, plus easy to get to from the highway. The staff were nice enough and the room was decent for the price, although strangely sticky carpet but otherwise clean. Would recommend for anyone looking for a good hotel around 100 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Margaret W
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights here. Our unit was basic but clean and had all we required. Air conditioner was a bit noisey (as most are). Staff were very helpful and polite. Access to metro was about 200 -300 metres away and the ideal way to travel to Universal Studios and Hollywood Boulevard. Price at $75 per night was very competitive which included a simple continental breakfast. Overall, ideal place for the things we did.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, basic sleeping place”
Reviews.Author: Exode
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Travelodge from arriving from Lax late at night. There was just enough room for our car but they have an additional parking lot within walking distance. The room was basic but clean. Everything you need was there. The neighbourhood was nothing special, there is a good thai restaurant next to the hotel. It took us a one hour walk to Sunset Strip but with the metro it only took 5 minutes. Breakfast contains of muffins and muffins, nothing fancy but ok. Overall ok, just a basic sleeping place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TheLegend1
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, with easy access to tourist areas by car. Breakfast is "Grab and Go" and consists of Muffins, Pastries, Fruit, Juice and Coffee/Tea. This is obtained from the reception area. The ceiling is not sound proof, as we could hear the people staying above us. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The maid did a very good job everyday. The staff are very polite and helpful. In the reception area they also have many leaflets for shopping, places to eat and tour companies Easy free parking is also available. The hotel also has a pool, but we did not use it We wanted a comfortable, clean hotel in a decnet location just to sleep in, as we where going to be out most of the day. This hotel is perfect for that. The only downside is the lack of soundproof celling.

Reviews.Title: “Staying near Hollywood Boulevard”
Reviews.Author: quindecim
Reviews.Content: We booked Travelodge Hollywood-Vermont/Sunset due to its close proximity to Hollywood Boulevard. The room was pretty average but at US$85.50 per night we couldn't expect more. The room was pretty comfortable for two and parking was easily available upfront. However, the sound insulation was really bad. We could hear people talking at night along the corridors and the sound of police sirens in the middle of the night. The free breakfast was adequate for a morning fill but not enough if you like having a heavy breakfast. The motel is recommended if you're looking for a no-frills accomodation that is near to the attractions in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: traveluva
Reviews.Content: I booked this for the first three nights of my stay in LA before moving downtown. I was under the impression that it was closer to the main points of interest in Hollywood and while it is two blocks from Hollywood Blvd. it is another 15 - 20 mins walk to the Chinese Theatre / Kodak theatre etc. but is is so close to the metro station and from there you can go anywhere in Los Angeles. The metro itself doesnt go to many places but it does connect you to a fairly decent bus service which does. Also it is close to the stop where the Griffith Observatory weekend dash stops so that was great. The hotel is fine... it was clean and toiletries were provided. Breakfast can be gotten at the main reception and consists of coffee, orange juice, muffins/pastries and some fruit. It wouldnt fill you for the day but it would keep you going for a while. Overall it was fine... dont expect it to be overly luxurious but it is a good enough base if you dont mind commuting or being a bit away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, right near the metro”
Reviews.Author: La_dolce_vita83
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here after a lengthy bus ride from santa monica to the metro. This hotel was in sight the moment we got off the train so we dicided to check it out. For what we paid (85$USD) the rooms were very clean, the beds were firm and comfortable and the general feel to the room was pleasant. It was so enjoyable we decided to stay an extra night and see all the sights we might have missed the first night. The location of the hotel (Sunset/Vermont) was a very safe neighbourhood. The local's were very friendly to us and it was far enough away from the seedyness and wierdness of central hollywood. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone and plan to stay here again in october.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the $$ and great location”
Reviews.Author: hdettmann
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Travelodge after 13 hours on a plane I was a bit concerned to see what appeared to be a scene fro 'Cops" taking place in the carpark. Our taxi driver said to be very careful in the area and to go straight to our room. We were travelling with our 13 month old daughter and I was getting very worried and was thinking about going elsewhere. But after a few hours sleep and a beautiful Californian day everything seemed ok! We thought the room was very clean and the maid service was great. The pool was clean and we used it almost every day, there were ice machines on each level and fantastic food places dotted along the streets everywhere. There a heaps of mini marts for food and drink supplies and Jon's supermarket a minute away. Its close to everything you want to go see, so just choose to take the subway, bus or hire a car... Staff were great and we would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Roberval
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel. A two-minute walk from the hotel to the subway station. Right in the middle of Sunset Boulevard and Santa Monica Boulevard. Easy access to buses for Sunset STrip or Venice Beach. One of the receptionist was very helpful....Ask for andy. Kept our luggage in the maintenace room without charging us a penny. Room was clean. Nothing luxirious but if you're looking for cheap but clean accommadion, that's it. The only negative point is breakfast. It was really basis. Juice was sugar and water. Coffee without milk but with creamer but there were bananas and apple.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for seeing the sights”
Reviews.Author: SB30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year and it was in a really good location. We bartered with the reception to get a good price which they gave us and they also provided us with a lot of good information on where to go and what to see. From this hotel on the Sunset strip you could walk a few blocks to Hollywood Boulevard, which has some great shops and a view of the Holly wood sign. It is probably best to have a car but as we did not we caught the bus to a fantastic shopping centre called Glendale.We also caught the bus from outside the hotel to a comedy club along the strip and also to Rodeo Drive, although we did have to walk to get to the actual road. The room was quite small but very comfy and it felt safe and secure. The reception also arranged our transfers for us to get back to the airport. I would definately recommend staying here for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “More than did the job...”
Reviews.Author: Winter_Log_Fires
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this hotel a "4". Not because it blew me away with it's egyptian sheets or Bose stereo - but because it is a 4 in it's category. It was more than adequate. Good sized room and bed. Clean, good location (just round the corner from the Scientology place if that's of interest). Metro 2 minutes walk - this can take you to the Hollywood sites - kodak theatre, street with the stars etc). Quite location too - set back from road. There is a swimming pool - though not very private - all the rooms look over it and it's in front of the hotel in the middle of the car park. Still nice idea. Parking right near rooms. Didn't have time to explore the local area/restauramts. We did have a car and used it to find restaurants (The Standard in the financial district is worth a look) so apart from the metro, can't really comment on the local area and self sufficiency without travel. Hotel had it's own fridge and microwave. The hotel did provide a breakfast though this is essentially a pastry and some coffee. We went to a market /juice bar about 5 minutes walk (turn left out of hotel, straight over the cross roads - juice bar on right and market further up on left). I would say "easy to find" but can't really comment. We took our Navman and didn't work out soon enough that North Vermont is N Vermont.... I suspect it is very easy to find if you're in a taxi and/or remember this advice for your sat nav... :)

Reviews.Title: “Otherwise ok BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Diii
Reviews.Content: ...we spent one evening killing cockroaches.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Hollywood-Vermont/Sunset
HotelInfo.Address: 1401 North Vermont Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
